kodkod.util.nodes
Class AnnotatedNode<N extends Node>

java.lang.Object
  kodkod.util.nodes.AnnotatedNode<N>

public final class AnnotatedNode<N extends Node>
extends Object

A node annotated with information about structural sharing in its ast/dag. The class also provides utility methods for collecting various information about annotated nodes.

Author:
Emina Torlak
specfield:
node: N // annotated node
source: node.*components ->one Node // maps the subnodes of this.node to nodes from // which they were derived by some transformation process // (e.g. skolemization, predicate inlining)

Method Detail

annotate

public static <N extends Node> AnnotatedNode<N> annotate(N node)
Returns an annotation for the given node. The source map of the returned annotation object maps each descendant of the node to itself.

Returns:
{ a: AnnotatedNode | a.node = node && a.source = node.*components<:iden }

annotate

public static <N extends Node> AnnotatedNode<N> annotate(N node,
                                                         Map<? extends Node,? extends Node> source)
Returns an annotation for the given node. The source map of the returned annotation object maps each descendant of the node to its value in the given source map, or to itself if the given source map has no value for that descendant.

Returns:
{ a: AnnotatedNode | a.node = node && a.source = (node.*components<:iden) ++ source }

annotateRoots

public static AnnotatedNode<Formula> annotateRoots(Formula formula)
Returns an annotation for an n-ary conjunctions of roots of the given formula. The source map of the returned annotation object maps each descendant of the node to itself. The root conjunction itself is mapped to the input formula.

Returns:
{ a: AnnotatedNode | a.node = Formula.and(Nodes.roots(formula)) && a.source = (node.^components<:iden) + a.node->formula }

freeVariableDetector

public final AbstractDetector freeVariableDetector()
Returns a Detector that will return TRUE when applied to a descendent of this.node iff the descendent contains a free variable.

Returns:
a Detector that will return TRUE when applied to a descendent of this.node iff the descendent contains a free variable.

node

public final N node()
Returns this.node.

Returns:
this.node

predicates

public final Map<RelationPredicate.Name,Set<RelationPredicate>> predicates()
Returns a map of RelationPredicate names to sets of top-level relation predicates with the corresponding names in this.node.

Returns:
a map of RelationPredicate names to sets of top-level relation predicates with the corresponding names in this.node. A predicate is considered 'top-level' if it is a component of the top-level conjunction, if any, of this.node.

quantifiedFormulaDetector

public final AbstractDetector quantifiedFormulaDetector()
Returns a Detector that will return TRUE when applied to a descendent of this.node iff the descendent contains a quantified formula.

Returns:
a Detector that will return TRUE when applied to a descendent of this.node iff the descendent contains a quantified formula.

relations

public final Set<Relation> relations()
Returns the set of all relations at the leaves of this annotated node.

Returns:
Relation & this.node.*components

sharedNodes

public final Set<Node> sharedNodes()
Returns the set of all non-leaf descendants of this.node that have more than one parent.

Returns:
{n: Node | some n.children && #(n.~components & this.node.*components) > 1 }

sourceOf

public final Node sourceOf(Node n)
Returns the source of the the given descendant of this.node.

Returns:
this.source[n]
requires:
n in this.node.*components

toString

public String toString()
Returns a string representation of this annotated node.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
string representation of this annotated node.

usesInts

public final boolean usesInts()
Returns true if this.node contains a child whose meaning depends on integer bounds (i.e. an ExprToIntCast node with SUM operator or an IntToExprCast node or Expression.INTS constant).

Returns:
true if this.node contains a child whose meaning depends on integer bounds (i.e. an ExprToIntCast node with SUM operator or an IntToExprCast node or Expression.INTS constant).
